name: Lunar Index
description:
Some sort of single-player deck builder.

Build and use your deck to take on all the enemies SPACE has to offer.

CREDITS

  • Card frames by Pali (https://pali.moe/)
  • Music by Kronington (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHlIB8V9gvMEmdHOnHmpmtg)
  • Player portrait and boss art (Marisa and Seiran) by The Nitoba (https://nitoba.tumblr.com/)
  • Game design and card art by PopeDarpa
  • Concept and card names by Metatronius
  • Programming and card art by bkez322
  • Programming by Porkchop650
  • Programming and any bugs by PSIDefenseUp

CONTROLS

  • Left Click to select a card
  • Right Click to deselect a selected card
  • With a card selected, left click on an enemy (or the play area when no target is required) to use the card
  • With a card selected, click the recycle button above it to sacrifice the card for +1 spell power per turn (once per turn)
  • Space or click the "End Turn" button to end your turn.

GAMEPLAY

Build and use your deck to take on all the enemies SPACE has to offer.

Each turn, 5 cards are drawn from your deck. If your deck is empty, your discard pile is reshuffled into it first.

You get 3 Spell Power per turn (before modifiers) with which to play cards of your choosing. Spell Power not used in a turn carries over to future turns.

At the end of each turn, you are provided with four choices of cards to add to your collection, and will need to choose two. Cards added this way are added to your discard pile.

The first two cards available after each turn are variations on basic spells, and these options grow in power as the game progresses. The right two are random choices from the pool of cards available to you (at your current tier).

Dodge is a temporary shield of sorts, allowing you to block an amount of damage until the next turn.

Make it far enough, and you'll meet (and inevitably be defeated by) a powerful foe. Best your enemies to claim victory.
